item.title: Maging Analyst
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Para makapag input, edit at mag-delete ng datos sa DRIVER website, dapat ang gumagamit ay mayroong pribilehiyong pang-Analyst. Ang mga sumusunod ang mga hakbang … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Para makapag input, edit at mag-delete ng datos sa DRIVER website, dapat ang gumagamit ay mayroong pribilehiyong pang-Analyst. Ang mga sumusunod ang mga hakbang upang maging Analyst:

  1. Bago mag-register, magtalaga ng isang/grupo ng mga opisyal na maglalagay ng datos sa DRIVER.
  2. Gamitin ang Gmail account para mabuksan ang DRIVER. Paki sundan ang ayos sa ibaba:

roadsafety.<your city/municipality/province>@gmail.com

(Example: roadsafety.pasig@gmail.com)

item.title: Blackspot Statistical Configuration
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

To access the black spot configuration, click the “System Settings” button at the top right of the Ashlar interface. Then set the severity threshold and click “Update”.

The black spot configuration consists of inputting a threshold for the percentile of locations to display. The percentile is relative to all road segments, and is represented as a decimal between 0 and 1.

Lower thresholds display more black spots; higher thresholds display only the most severe black spots. Updating the threshold does not have an immediate effect in DRIVER, but the update will be visible after the next scheduled run of the black spot calculation script.

item.title: Economic Loss & Societal Harm
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

The DRIVER website displays two widgets that calculate Economic Loss & Societal Harm. These widgets’ results also adjust according to what filters are set by the user.


To set costs for economic loss and societal harm, expand the Incidents navigation tab and click on “Cost aggregation settings”.

The interface provides formatting options for currency, the type of content, and field to associate with
costs. Only option-type fields are available for associating costs.

item.title: Adding & Editing Geographic Boundaries
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

The DRIVER website allows users to view areas in its map with Geographic Boundaries, particularly according to Region, and City/Province.

Administrators may also add new Geographic Boundaries using the Ashlar Schema Editor.

Viewing Geographic Boundaries

To view the list of Geographic Boundaries available on the DRIVER website, click on the “View All Geographies” button found at the bottoom of the sidebar on the left.

Adding Geographic Boundaries

To add a new Geographic Boundary, click on the “Add New Geography” button found below the “View All Geographies” button on the sidebar.

The administrator must add a Geography Label, upload a shapefile, and set a Geography Color (for instance, the red and green geography colors of the Region and City/Province boundaries, respectively).

Upon upload, the admin user can select a display field for the new Geographic Boundary.

item.title: Related Content Types
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

“Related Content” is the term used in the Ashlar Editor to refer to sub-categories within the Input Forms on the DRIVER website.

Examples of Related Content are Vehicles, People, and Photos, which currently fall under the “Incident Input Form” of the Incidents Record Type.

Admin users may view, edit, or add Related Content using the Ashlar Schema Editor.

Viewing Related Content Types

Related Content may be viewed by clicking on the “View Related Content” link on the sidebar on the left side of the screen. Clicking on this will lead the admin user to a list of all Related Content available for the selected Record Type (in this case, the Record Type is “Incidents”, and the Related Contents falling under it are “Vehicles”, People”, and “Photos”.

Editing Related Content

Clicking on the “Edit” button on the right side of each Related Content Entry will let admin users edit its details, which will reflect on the DRIVER website as additional fields/categories for Analyst users to fill up.

From here, admin users may choose what type of field or content they would like to reflect on the selected Record Type DRIVER website. They may also edit the elements of the Related Content Types above. For instance, if the admin user wants to add a text field as a Related Content Type, they may do so on this page by choosing from the dropdown pictured below:

Adding Related Content

Admin users may add Related Content by clicking the “Add Related Content” link on the left sidebar of the Ashlar Editor, or by clicking on the “Add New Content” button on the top right corner of the Related Content’s page.

From here, users may add in the singular and plural forms of their chosen record type label. For instance, if the user wishes to name the new record type “Incidents”, they must set “Incident” as the singular label of the record type, and “Incidents” as the plural label. These labels will adjust accordingly on the DRIVER website, depending on whether a DRIVER user adds one or multiple entries.

Adding Multiple Entries in a Single Related Content Type

Clicking on the “Allow Multiple?” checkbox at the bottom left side of the page will allow DRIVER Analyst users to add more than one entry within a Related Content Type. For example, if the admin wants the Analyst user to add more than one Vehicle in the Incident Input Form, then the “Allow Multiple?” checkbox must be ticked.

Deleting Related Content

To delete Related Content, simply click on the “Trash” button located on the rightmost side of each Related Content entry.

item.title: Record Types
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

Record Types on the DRIVER website may be added via the Ashlar Schema Editor. As of the moment, there are two Record Types on the DRIVER website: Incidents and Interventions.


View All Record Types

These two Record Types (and succeeding record types) may be viewed in the Ashlar Editor on the sidebar seen on the left. Clicking on the “View all record types” button takes the user to the available record types, where they can add, edit, or delete details of their selected Record Type.

Clicking on the “Preview” button on the far right of the Record Type will take the user to a preview of the Record Type’s Input Form on the DRIVER website. In the preview, users may click the “Expand” button to view more details of the Record Type’s input form.

Editing Record Types

Clicking on the “Edit” button on the right side of each Record Type entry will let admin users edit its details, which will reflect on the DRIVER website.

Deleting Record Types

To delete Record Types, simply click on the “Trash” button located on the rightmost side of each Record Type entry.

item.title: Adding New Users
item.dc:creator: gambit
item.description: Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in … Read more →
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, this entry is only available in English. For the sake of viewer convenience, the content is shown below in the alternative language. You may click the link to switch the active language.

To add new users, simply click on the “Add New User” button under the User Management page, which you can access by clicking “Manage Users” on the top right corner of the Ashlar Editor.

Upon clicking the “Add New User” button, the Ashlar Editor will redirect you to a new page labelled “Create User Account”.

From here, you may create a user by filling the necessary details shown, as well as provide the user with a password.

Click on the “CreateUser” button below to create the user account.
